[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Drop behavior] When PartialStateComputeResult is dropped, are all OnceCell resources properly cleaned up even if they were never initialized? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Optional ledger_info validation] Can ExecutedChunk be created with ledger_info_opt set to None, allowing chunks to be executed without proper consensus signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Output-ledger_info consistency] Is there validation that the PartialStateComputeResult output matches the LedgerInfoWithSignatures, or can they be inconsistent causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [LedgerInfoWithSignatures validation] When ledger_info_opt is Some, are the signatures properly verified before the ExecutedChunk is processed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Missing validation] Can ExecutedChunk be constructed directly without validation, bypassing checks on output and ledger_info_opt consistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Empty chunk handling] Can an ExecutedChunk with empty PartialStateComputeResult.execution_output but valid ledger_info_opt cause validators to commit empty blocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Reconfiguration in chunk] If output indicates reconfiguration (has_reconfiguration()), does ExecutedChunk enforce that ledger_info_opt must be present? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Signature quorum] When ledger_info_opt contains LedgerInfoWithSignatures, is the signature quorum properly validated against the current validator set? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Epoch mismatch] Can ledger_info_opt reference a different epoch than the one in output.execution_output.next_epoch_state, causing epoch confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [State root verification] Does ExecutedChunk verify that the state root in ledger_info_opt matches the state root computed from output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Transaction version] Can the transaction version in ledger_info_opt be manipulated to be inconsistent with the actual executed transactions in output? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Timestamp validation] Is the timestamp in ledger_info_opt validated against block time constraints, or can it be set to arbitrary values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [None ledger_info handling] When ledger_info_opt is None, what prevents this chunk from being incorrectly committed without proper consensus agreement? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Partial output] Can output be a partially-initialized PartialStateComputeResult (missing state_checkpoint_output or ledger_update_output) when ExecutedChunk is created? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Output immutability] Does ExecutedChunk ensure output cannot be modified after construction, or can the PartialStateComputeResult be mutated later? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Clone semantics] Since ExecutedChunk derives Debug but not Clone, can this lead to accidental moves and use-after-move bugs in executor code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Memory ownership] Who owns the PartialStateComputeResult output - does ExecutedChunk take ownership or just hold a reference, and can this cause use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Chunk ordering] Can ExecutedChunk instances be processed out-of-order, causing validators to apply state changes in different sequences? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Integration] Can an ExecutedChunk reference a PartialStateComputeResult that is still being initialized concurrently, causing race conditions in state commits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Integration] If ExecutedChunk.output.get_complete_result() returns None, how does the executor handle this, and can it lead to partial state commits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Integration] When ExecutedChunk.output has reconfiguration (has_reconfiguration() == true), is ledger_info_opt required to contain the new epoch validator set? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Integration] Can the state_checkpoint_output in output be set after ExecutedChunk is created, modifying chunk semantics post-construction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Integration] If output.expect_complete_result() panics when ExecutedChunk is processed, does this crash the validator or is it caught? (High)
